intro: Fevillea monosperma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and indirect sunlight. Its compact growth habit makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Fevillea monosperma is also noted for its ornamental value and ease of care.
